I‚Äôm not just a programmer; I carry the discipline of someone who spent over a decade ensuring 24/7 critical systems never failed.
overview.marketing_note: Alongside the technical path, I have training in Digital Marketing. That product awareness helps me think about the end user, communicate clearly, and deliver value before technology.
overview.next_text: Who I am shows up in how I build. The next section lays out the engineering I practice today.

development.title: Software Engineering
development.description: Focused on Python and on simplifying the complex. To me, code is a tool for stability.

skills.title: Python Ecosystem (I & II)
skills.context_text: Structured, demanding training from the University of Helsinki (Programming I & II). Solid grasp of algorithms, data structures, and OOP.
skills.background: I moved from technical support to programmatic computing through an intensive 540h training path. Where others see a script, I see a resilient automation system.

skills.title: EFA Programmer Program
skills.context_text: 1416h program focused on modern technologies and engineering best practices. In progress.
skills.background: Currently consolidating knowledge in modern architectures, ensuring a solid technical base translates into robust, scalable web applications.

development.next_text: What I do today rests on rigor built before programming. Next, the technical foundation that shaped it.

foundation.title: Technical Foundation
foundation.description: Two decades of evolution. From critical infrastructure to software engineering.

experience.summary_text: Managing critical banking infrastructure in Lisbon and Madrid. Uncompromising discipline on stability.
experience.details_text: Eight years dedicated to ensuring uninterrupted operation of core banking systems. Here, technology was the structure that enabled trust in the global market.
experience.intro_quote: The peak of responsibility. Eight years in the financial core where error tolerance was zero.
experience.challenge_text: 24/7 banking environment. PowerShell automation became vital to manage thousands of servers with absolute stability.
experience.key_learning_text: Zero Downtime Mindset. Absolute rigor and the understanding that stability is a continuous automation process.
experience.present_link: I apply this discipline in development: resilient, tested code focused on unquestionable availability.

experience.summary_text: Technical support in a high-demand industrial environment in Madrid.
experience.details_text: Network systems and terminals supporting large-scale energy logistics. Where digital meets physical.
experience.intro_quote: Industrial robustness. Every system stop had an immediate, tangible physical cost.
experience.challenge_text: Refinery and heavy logistics environment. Physical pressure for fast resolution under adverse conditions.
experience.key_learning_text: Obsession with robustness. Software and systems must survive worst-case scenarios, not only the happy path.
experience.present_link: I write software prepared for partial failures, ensuring predictability and safety in my systems.

experience.summary_text: Support for the early days of cloud infrastructure and virtualization.
experience.details_text: The transition from physical to logical. Support for corporate cloud and virtualization at scale.
experience.intro_quote: The era of scale. Where I learned that large infrastructures are built with layers of abstraction.
experience.challenge_text: Managing complexity at scale. Understanding how virtual instances interact without physical conflicts.
experience.key_learning_text: Systems thinking. Seeing the full architecture before acting on isolated components.
experience.present_link: This abstract view allows me to design modular, scalable software architectures.

experience.summary_text: From early pharma support to managing international experiences.
experience.details_text: Started in 1999 as an IT technician. Followed by a deliberate, enriching pause in Tourism and Customer Success in Norway.
experience.intro_quote: The human foundation. Between early tech work and multicultural management in Oslo, I learned the value of communication.
experience.challenge_text: High-rotation multicultural environments. Managing expectations and fast diagnostics under social pressure.
experience.key_learning_text: Empathy as diagnosis. Understanding user pain is half the technical solution.
experience.present_link: I translate complex business needs into code that solves real problems for real people.

foundation.next_text: Experience shaped how I think. Now, the mindset I bring to code.

mindset.title: Mindset & Human Logic
mindset.subtitle: The patience of bread, the precision of code
mindset.philosophy: My reasoning is deterministic. I believe in the process, the right timing of each stage, and the absolute isolation of variables to solve any problem.

adoption.title: Structural Responsibility and Long-Term Commitment
adoption.story_text: My son was adopted 4 years ago. The adoption was a long, structured, demanding, and regulated process that requires patience, predictability, emotional stability, and consistent routines.
adoption.engineering_note: For me, this proves high-level human skills: long-term commitment, organization, discipline, and strict compliance with processes. The same skills I apply to critical systems, long projects, and code that cannot fail.

blocks.title: Bread & Dependencies
blocks.story_text: In artisanal bread, skipping steps destroys the result. Fermentation time is a dependency that cannot be rushed without compromising structure.
blocks.engineering_note: In software, robust architectures require the right time for design and validation. Respecting dependencies and code maturation prevents catastrophic technical debt.

blocks.title: Pizza & Iteration
blocks.story_text: A perfect pizza is the result of small adjustments in each batch. Temperature, hydration, time ‚Äî each detail is refined based on the previous result.
blocks.engineering_note: Programming is iteration. I prefer small, frequent deliveries that allow rapid course correction, ensuring the final product matches reality.

blocks.title: Maintenance & Prevention
blocks.story_text: Gel nail maintenance taught me that prevention is cheaper than repair. Small, frequent care avoids larger failures and preserves integrity ‚Äî it‚Äôs not aesthetics, it‚Äôs continuous maintenance.
blocks.engineering_note: In software, prevention is constant refactoring, regular tests, and daily attention to detail. The same logic avoids silent failures and keeps systems reliable over time.

blocks.title: Marketing & Product Awareness
blocks.story_text: My first contact with digital marketing was unplanned. It emerged during gel nail training: most nail technicians work alone, so the course included marketing basics. Continued exposure led me to self-study and technical curiosity. For me, marketing is not a parallel career ‚Äî it is product awareness.
blocks.engineering_note: That awareness translates into three pillars in software: thinking about the end user, communicating clearly, and delivering value before technology.

blocks.title: Laws & Systems
blocks.story_text: My interest in laws and electoral systems is not political. It‚Äôs a fascination with explicit rules, procedural precision, and system integrity. In an electoral process, every step is validated to ensure trust in the outcome.
blocks.engineering_note: I see this as a structured cognitive exercise, similar to a systems audit: intact data, auditable transitions, and clear rules at every stage.

mindset.next_text: Next, what I‚Äôm looking for right now ‚Äî the bridge between story and action.

now.title: What I‚Äôm looking for right now
now.summary: I‚Äôm looking for a host organization for the mandatory 210-hour curricular internship in the EFA ‚Äì Programmer program.
now.details: The theoretical phase ends at the end of June, and the internship can start from June 2026. It is supervised by the training entity, with an individual plan and defined objectives. I‚Äôm looking for a real development or systems context, preferably remote (nationwide) with a hybrid alternative in the Bragan√ßa area. I‚Äôve already had practical programming contact during the course, so the internship doesn‚Äôt start from zero. The contact is to align expectations and fit.

contact.title: Contact Me
contact.description: Available for projects where technical maturity and human commitment make the difference.
